title: Unit tests should not perform logging,but some tests still use

comments.content: Without more details about this, it is hard to tell what this bug is about. How can code not perform logging just because it is in unit tests? Heck, some tests actually verify that messages are being logged.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~amrith

comments.content:
> Unit tests should not perform logging

Why not? Debugging is useful.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dolph

comments.content: marking incomplete for Trove per IRC chat with keystone folks.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~amrith

comments.content: Without any presenting any reasoning or justification, this "bug" seems opinionated, wasteful, and counter-productive.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dolph

comments.content: I have to agree with Dolph. I'm inclined to mark it as "won't fix" for glance.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~icordasc

comments.content:
@Dolph Mathews (dolph) Ian Cordasco (icordasc) 

Hello, i'm sorry to give the reason here so later.But in the cinder HACKING.rst,you can see the Cinder Specific Commandments [C309].You will see :Unit tests should not perform logging.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~liang-jingtao

comments.content: Marking as WONTFIX for now because I don't think this is a keystone issue at all. If you find a place in keystone where there is a problem feel free to reopen.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dstanek

comments.content: Nova has no rules in place which forbids that, so it's not a bug. I also don't see a reason to put effort into this.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content: Nova has no rules in place which forbids that, so it's not a bug. I also don't see a reason to put effort into this.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content: This is not a bug (in Trove).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~amrith
